job.title: Senior Software Engineer
job.description:
We are looking for a hardworking, innovative, and goal driven Senior Software Engineer to join our Enterprise Information Management team for a new HTML & Angular project. The ideal candidate will have excellent front-end and Angular development skills, including developing new user interfaces from scratch. Candidates should possess complementary skills on the back-end API and database layers.
Remote candidates are acceptable, with a preference for local candidates in the Las Vegas or Henderson, NV area.
Responsibilities:
•	Develop quality Enterprise Information Management software utilizing Microsoft software development languages and tools.
•	Create software designs for enhancements or features based on best practices.
•	Participates in code and design reviews. Makes updates based on review recommendations.
•	Keeps current on latest Microsoft development products.
•	Provide support and maintenance on existing applications with the assistance of more experienced engineers as needed.
•	Documents and demonstrates solutions by developing documentation, flowcharts, layouts, diagrams, charts, code comments and clear code with the assistance of more experienced engineers as needed.
•	Demonstrate code quality through proper unit and other testing.
•	Break down user stories into component tasks and provide estimates with the assistance of more experienced engineers as needed.
•	Work in a collaborative development environment with a team of developers.
The above statements are intended only to describe the general nature of the job, and should not be construed as an all-inclusive list of position responsibilities.
Requirements:
•	Previous Software Engineering experience (6+ years).
•	Front End Development
o HTML5 (5+ years).
o CSS3 (5+ years).
o Angular 6+ (4+ years).
•	Back End Development
o .Net/.Net Core/C#/EF/MSSQL experience (5+ years).
o C# (5+ years).
o ASP.NET (5+ years).
o SQL Server 2008/12/16+ (6+ years).
•	Visual Studio 2015+ / Visual Studio Code (5+ years).
•	Object Oriented Programming (OOP) and software patterns.
•	Basic understanding of agile software development principles and techniques. Understand iterative software development.
•	Basic understanding of the software development lifecycle and multiple software development approaches.
•	Desire to be part of a highly productive, fast-paced team.
•	Four-year college degree or equivalent.
•	Organized and detail-oriented.
•	Working knowledge of Git version control system.
•	Experience working on a Scrum team
Preferred:
•	Knowledge of third-party JavaScript libraries (RxJS, Ngrx, Angular Material, etc)
•	Knowledge of credit union and/or banking industry.
The above statements are intended only to describe the general nature of the job, and should not be construed as an all-inclusive list of position responsibilities.
Employee Polygraph Protection Act
Equal Employment Opportunity
Family and Medical Leave Act
